urls.title: Getting the Most Out of the 2022 Annual Meeting … In Person AND Virtually! | ASH News Daily | American Society of Hematology
urls.description: 2022 marks 64 years of presenting the best science in hematology to the world. That’s a lot of time to get things right, change with the times, and innovate for the sake of attendees and the g lobal profession overall. Compared to the three short years that the ASH annual meeting has been held with a virtual component, 64 years is literally a lifetime. It also puts into perspective the strides of the previous few years since going virtual. Like last year, 2022 sees the continued evolution of a customized

5/9 https://t.co/Y2Qe6jA8yw

urls.title: Annual Meeting Schedule-at-a-Glance
urls.description: All times listed reflect the Central time zone. Unless otherwise noted, all events will take place in person and on the virtual platform. Beginning at 9:00 a.m. Preview Day (virtual platform only) Preview Day is an opportunity to explore the annual meeting virtual platform and become familiar with its features and navigation. Participants will not have access to pre-recorded presentations that are subject to an embargo (i.e., oral abstract presentations and poster presentations). All Day Preview Day

urls.title: 2022 Hematology Review Series
urls.description: The ASH Hematology Review Series is designed for fellows preparing to take the internal medicine hematology certification exam or those desiring a comprehensive update of hematology standards of care. This series p rovides a review of hematology patterned after the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) Certification Examination Blueprint. The 2022 ASH Hematology Review Series will air two to three episodes every week from July through October 2022 leading up to the fall Board Exams. At the beginning

urls.title: ASH VTE Guidelines: Pediatrics
urls.description: Pediatric VTE is considered a severe problem because of the potential for associated mortality and significant complications including PE, and cerebrovascular events, as well as post-thrombotic syndrome. Over recent years there has been a dramatic increase in available information, knowledge, and expertise in relation to appropriate diagnosis, prevention, and clinical management of VTE in neonates and children. The purpose of these guidelines is to provide evidence-based recommendations about the management of VTE in this population.

urls.title: ASH Minority Recruitment Initiative
urls.description: The ASH Minority Recruitment Initiative (MRI) was created in 2003 to increase the participation of underrepresented minorities training in hematology-related fields and to increase the number of minority hematologists with academic and research appointments. The Minority Hematology Fellow Award (MHFA) encourages junior researchers to pursue careers in academic hematology by providing research funding and mentorship over a two-to-three year period. urls.title: American Society of Hematology - Covac Global
urls.description: Covac Global revolutionized medical evacuation without the burden of hospitalization requirements. Our in-house medical staff and worldwide medical transport teams stand ready to bring our members back to their home or hospital of choice without first being hospitalized at the location of injury or illness. Our indemnified membership covers medical transportation for medical emergencies (including obstetric issues, accidents, illness, etc.). Our teams stand ready 24/7 to provide our members support.

urls.title: ASH Annual Meeting Abstracts
urls.description: Abstracts submitted for oral and poster presentations at the ASH annual meeting represent important, novel research in the field and are considered the best of the thousands of abstracts submitted. Typically, more than 5,000 scientific abstracts are submitted each year and more than 3,000 abstracts are accepted for oral and poster presentations through an extensive peer review process. The Plenary Scientific Sess ion, which includes the top six abstracts as selected by the Program Committee, is traditional

urls.title: ASH VTE Guidelines: Pediatrics
urls.description: Pediatric VTE is considered a severe problem because of the potential for associated mortality and significant complications including PE, and cerebrovascular events, as well as post-thrombotic syndrome. Over recent years there has been a dramatic increase in available information, knowledge, and expertise in relation to appropriate diagnosis, prevention, and clinical management of VTE in neonates and children. The purpose of these guidelines is to provide evidence-based recommendations about the management of VTE in this population.

urls.title: ASH Annual Meeting Abstracts
urls.description: Abstracts submitted for oral and poster presentations at the ASH annual meeting represent important, novel research in the field and are considered the best of the thousands of abstracts submitted. Typically, more than 5,000 scientific abstracts are submitted each year and more than 3,000 abstracts are accepted for oral and poster presentations through an extensive peer review process. The Plenary Scientific Sess ion, which includes the top six abstracts as selected by the Program Committee, is traditional

urls.title: Providing Cutting-Edge, Practical Programming | ASH Clinical News | American Society of Hematology
urls.description: As co-chairs of the Education Program, what were your goals in putting the program together? Dr. Odenike: We wanted to make sure that the program was as contemporary and as comprehensive as possible. We are in a very fast-paced, ever-changing world in hematology, and we wanted to make sure the audience was brought up to speed on some of the most exciting developments in today’s era. Dr. Garcia: I would totally agree with that, and I would add that while the ASH Annual Meeting Education Program already

urls.title: FDA Approves First Gene Therapy to Treat Adults with Hemophilia B
urls.description: The FDA approved Hemgenix, a gene therapy for the treatment of adults with Hemophilia B.

urls.title: American Society of Hematology - Covac Global
urls.description: Covac Global revolutionized medical evacuation without the burden of hospitalization requirements. Our in-house medical staff and worldwide medical transport teams stand ready to bring our members back to their home or hospital of choice without first being hospitalized at the location of injury or illness. Our indemnified membership covers medical transportation for medical emergencies (including obstetric issues, accidents, illness, etc.). Our teams stand ready 24/7 to provide our members support.

urls.description: Dr. Naseema Gangat (@n_gangat) graduated from medical school at Aga Khan University in Karachi, Pakistan, and attended Mayo Clinic College of Medicine for her internal medicine residency and hematology/oncology fellowship. She continues to call the Mayo Clinic and Rochester, Minnesota, home and is currently a professor of medicine in the division of hematology. 2022 marks Dr. Gangat’s third serving on the ASH News Daily editorial board — she was an Author in 2018, became Editor in 2021, and clearly is
